intro: Iris alexeenkoi, commonly known as the Caucasus iris, is a species native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking blue to violet flowers with a distinctive three-lobed lower petal. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, sword-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or woodland settings. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
